cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the eastern Gulf and on course for the north-central Gulf Coast (Mississippi/Alabama shoreline)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi–Alabama coast (roughly between the mouth of the Pearl River and the AL/FL border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-Surge Watch west of Shell Beach to the Mouth of the Mississippi River and east of Dauphin Island to Navarre, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from the Mouth of the Pearl River to the Alabama-Florida border; Storm-Surge Warning Shell Beach, LA to Dauphin Island, AL (includes Mobile Bay)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana across Mississippi and Alabama to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (73% chance); a low 3% chance of hurricane-force gusts near landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in Mobile Bay as onshore flow peaks near landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals to 12 inches capable of flash flooding in and around Mobile.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands and brief white-out squalls reducing visibility for port operations.
